pullRequest.title: fix(griffin) - insert as select without nominating timestamp - fixed #364 #349
pullRequest.bodyText:
To summarise, this is what it's fixed on  the PR:

insert as select without nominating timestamp
timestamp_sequence can take systimestamp()
invalid argument(s) for function is not longer reported as unknown function

commit.message: fix(griffin) - insert as select without nominating timestamp

nodes.bodyText:
hmm, lets consider the following:

user is inserting "string" into timestamp column? what do they get as an error?
user chose not to populate timestamp column of writer? what do they get as an error?
user assigned column X to timestamp column of the writer, but somehow nominated Y to be column of the cursor? what do they get as an error?

commit.message: fix(griffin) - insert as select without nominating timestamp #349
fix(griffin) - insert as select without nominating timestamp #349 #365

nodes.bodyText: could we move this to test source tree?
